meta.canonicalTitle: EFL Load Prescription Standards v2.2.0 - Complete Force-Velocity Curve Targeting Edition
meta.authority: NSCA Guidelines 2019, Chen et al. 2023, Samozino et al. 2016, Morin & Samozino 2016
meta.majorEnhancement: LAYER 3 COMPLETE - Explicit F-V curve targeting with bias profiles

v2.2.0: ✨ MAJOR: Added Layer 3 force-velocity curve targeting framework
✨ NEW: CMJ profiling integration with RSI, peak force, RFD metrics
✨ NEW: F-V slope testing integration (Samozino methodology)
✨ NEW: Band:Tier ratio targets by bias type
✨ NEW: Gate 7 validation - F-V bias compliance checking
✨ NEW: Coaching decision tree for bias selection
✨ NEW: Seasonal and population-specific bias guidelines
⚠️ SAFETY: All v2.1.4 safety gates maintained (MEV/MAV/MRV, caps, windows)
⚠️ YOUTH: Youth 16 and under enforced BALANCED (no bias targeting)
📊 SCOPE: Primarily adult elite athletes (2yr+ training age)
🔧 ARCHITECTURE: Sits ABOVE Load Standards, never violates safety gates

philosophyStatement.corePrinciple: Complete force-velocity framework with three operational layers
philosophyStatement.layer1: Spectrum Coverage - Band0-4, E0-E4, Zone 1-8 (COMPLETE v2.0+)
philosophyStatement.layer2: Dose Control - MEV/MAV/MRV, caps, budgets, recovery (COMPLETE v2.1.4)
philosophyStatement.layer3: Curve Shaping - Explicit force vs velocity targeting (NEW v2.2.0)
philosophyStatement.safetyFirst: Layer 3 sits ABOVE Load Standards - never violates MEV/MAV/MRV, band ceilings, tier caps, or recovery windows
philosophyStatement.populationProtection: Youth 16 and under enforced BALANCED - no optimization targeting until structural maturity

systemOverview.description: Layer 3 force-velocity curve targeting system enabling explicit force-deficit or velocity-deficit bias
systemOverview.architecture: Sits ABOVE Load Standards - flavors distribution within safety limits
systemOverview.optional: System functions without F-V bias - BALANCED is always safe default
systemOverview.diagnostics: CMJ profiling, F-V slope testing, or practical assessments inform bias selection
systemOverview.validation: New Gate 7 checks F-V bias compliance before program approval

FORCE_BIASED.targetAdaptation: Shift athlete rightward on F-V curve → increase force production capacity

indicators: Fast reactive movements but low force output
Good acceleration, poor max velocity maintenance
sportExamples: Guards with speed but lacking finishing power
Forwards who can't elevate after contact

prescription.sprintVolume: Lower end of season range (minimal velocity emphasis)

mustObey: Band4 frequency cap (max 2x/week OFFSEASON, 0x INSEASON T1)
validationRules.cannotOverride: Any safety gate from Load Standards v2.1.4

VELOCITY_BIASED.targetAdaptation: Shift athlete leftward on F-V curve → increase velocity/rate coding capacity

indicators: Slow SSC, long ground contact times
Good max force but slow rate of force development
sportExamples: Linemen with force but slow first step

prescription.sprintVolume: Upper end of season range (maximize velocity emphasis)

mustObey: Landing mechanics quality gate (7+/10 score required)
validationRules.specialCaution: High elastic volume requires excellent tissue tolerance and movement quality
validationRules.injuryRisk: Elevated if tissue health or landing quality compromised

BALANCED.targetAdaptation: General athletic development, maintain F-V profile

targetAthlete.profile: No clear force or velocity deficit, or diagnostics unavailable

validationRules.mustObey: All Load Standards limits (same as v2.1.4)
validationRules.philosophy: Safe default for all populations and training ages
validationRules.override: Coach can select FORCE or VELOCITY bias with clear rationale and testing

diagnosticInputs.philosophy: OPTIONAL testing to inform bias selection. System defaults to BALANCED if unavailable.
diagnosticInputs.status: NOT REQUIRED - coaches can select bias based on observation

cmj_Profiling.method: Countermovement jump with force plate or jump mat
cmj_Profiling.optimalData: Peak force (N), RFD (N/s), Impulse (N·s), Ground contact time (ms)

indicators: Jump height moderate but takeoff velocity high
Short ground contact time but low impulse
High force production but slow RFD
Long ground contact time, high impulse but low velocity

balanced.indicators: Metrics within expected ranges for sport/position

fv_Slope_Testing.method: Multiple loaded jumps (Samozino protocol) or sprint profiling
fv_Slope_Testing.equipment: Barbell + jump mat OR sprint timing gates + video

protocol.sprintProfile: 30m sprint with 5m splits (force-velocity from acceleration curve)

metrics.F0: Theoretical max force (y-intercept of F-V line)
metrics.V0: Theoretical max velocity (x-intercept of F-V line)
metrics.FV_imbalance: % deviation from optimal F-V relationship for sport

fv_Slope_Testing.reference: Samozino et al. 2016, Morin & Samozino 2016, Jiménez-Reyes et al. 2017

practicalAssessments.description: No-equipment assessments for bias selection when force plates unavailable

rsi_JumpHeight_Ratio.test: 10-second repeat CMJ test + single max CMJ
rsi_JumpHeight_Ratio.measurement: RSI (jump height / contact time) and max jump height

interpretation.>2.0x BW: Potential velocity deficit (verify with speed tests) → VELOCITY_BIASED

strengthToBodyweight.note: Must have 6+ months squatting experience for valid test

sprintSplitAnalysis.calculation: (40y time - 10y time) compared to normative data

defaultBehavior.noDiagnostics: Default to BALANCED (safe, effective for general development)
defaultBehavior.coachOverride: Coach can manually select bias based on: sport position demands, observation of movement quality, athlete training history, season and phase context
defaultBehavior.requiresDocumentation: If overriding BALANCED without testing, document rationale in athlete profile

blockLevelApplication.duration: F-V bias applied for 2-8 week blocks
workflow: 1. ASSESS: Test athlete F-V profile (diagnostics or practical)
3. GENERATE: System 3 creates program within bias targets
4. VALIDATE: Check Gate 7 (F-V bias compliance) + all v2.1.4 gates
5. MONITOR: Weekly check-ins (readiness, performance, tissue health)
6. ADJUST: Mid-block adjustment only with Coach approval + re-validation

transitionRules.betweenBlocks: 2-week baseline (BALANCED) recommended between extreme bias blocks
transitionRules.biasProgression: Can run FORCE → BALANCED → VELOCITY across off-season
transitionRules.forbidden: FORCE → VELOCITY direct transition without baseline buffer

OFFSEASON.rationale: Highest capacity for strength development, low sport load enables heavy training
OFFSEASON.avoid: VELOCITY_BIASED unless clear deficit (save for closer to competition)

PRESEASON.rationale: Transition to sport-specific power, reduce CNS fatigue before season

INSEASON_all_tiers.rationale: Competition load high, avoid extreme bias that increases injury risk or fatigue
INSEASON_all_tiers.exception: INSEASON Tier 3 (low fixture density) can use moderate bias if readiness GREEN

POSTSEASON.rationale: Restoration phase, general development, avoid CNS stacking

requirements: Documented testing or clear performance limiter

Adult_Intermediate.conditionalBias: FORCE or VELOCITY only with clear deficit + coach approval
Adult_Intermediate.caution: Monitor closely for overload - may lack adaptation capacity for extreme bias

Youth_17_Advanced.rationale: Late-stage adolescents can tolerate moderate bias but not extreme targeting

Youth_16_and_under.rationale: Developmental priorities override optimization. General athletic development required. Structural maturity incomplete.
Youth_16_and_under.override: Director-level only with medical clearance (rare - injury rehab context only)

gate7_FVBiasValidation.name: Force-Velocity Bias Compliance Check
gate7_FVBiasValidation.purpose: Validate weekly program distribution matches selected F-V bias targets
gate7_FVBiasValidation.when: After Gates 1-6 pass, before program approval

calculations.bandDistribution: Count total sets per band (Band0-4), calculate percentages
calculations.plyoDistribution: Count total contacts per E-node (E0-E4), calculate percentages

step2_compareToTargets.logic: For each band/tier, check if actual within target range ±10%

step4_validateSafetyGates.description: Ensure F-V bias did NOT violate any v2.1.4 safety gates
checks: Band4 sets per session ≤ population cap
step4_validateSafetyGates.criticalRule: If ANY safety gate violated, Gate 7 = RED regardless of bias compliance

PASS_GREEN.condition: Actual distribution within bias targets ±10% AND all safety gates passed
PASS_GREEN.logging: Log actual distribution vs targets for monitoring

CAUTION_YELLOW.condition: Distribution outside targets 10-20% BUT safety gates still passed
CAUTION_YELLOW.action: Flag for coach review - program functional but off-target
recommendations: Adjust next week to correct drift
Consider if bias selection appropriate for phase

FAIL_RED.condition: Distribution >20% off-target OR any safety gate violated
FAIL_RED.action: QUARANTINE program - do not assign to athlete

recommendations.ifBiasOffTarget: Regenerate program with stricter bias constraints
recommendations.ifSafetyViolated: Reduce volume/intensity to meet safety gates first
recommendations.ifBothIssues: Consider switching to BALANCED bias or adjusting block parameters

specialCases.BALANCED_bypass: If bias = BALANCED, Gate 7 automatically passes (no distribution targets)
specialCases.Youth_16_under_enforcement: If population = Youth 16 and under, system enforces BALANCED and Gate 7 validates no bias targeting occurred
specialCases.INSEASON_enforcement: If season = INSEASON (any tier except Tier 3), enforce BALANCED and reject FORCE/VELOCITY bias

displayFormat.safetyStatus: Show all Gate 1-6 results with pass/fail
displayFormat.recommendation: If YELLOW/RED, display specific adjustment needed

actions.adjust: If YELLOW, coach can manually adjust or regenerate
actions.reject: If RED, must fix before assignment

coachingDecisionSupport.description: Practical guidance for coaches selecting and monitoring F-V bias

step1.question: Is athlete Youth 16 or under?
step1.ifYes: → USE BALANCED (enforced by system, no override)

step2.question: Is athlete Adult with 2+ years training age?

step3.question: Is current season OFFSEASON or PRESEASON?

step4.question: Do you have testing data (CMJ, force plate, RSI, or squat 1RM)?

step5.question: What does testing indicate?
step5.forceDeficit: → USE FORCE_BIASED (squat <1.5x BW, high RSI, low peak force)
step5.velocityDeficit: → USE VELOCITY_BIASED (squat >2.0x BW, low RSI, slow RFD)

weeklyCheckIn.frequency: Every 7 days during F-V bias block
assessments: Performance trends (jump height, sprint times if tracked)

triggers: Tissue health issues (tendon soreness, joint pain)
Athlete reports excessive fatigue or motivation loss
switchToBALANCED.action: Immediately switch to BALANCED, regenerate program
switchToBALANCED.documentation: Log reason for switch and athlete response

indicators: Athlete adapting well to training stress

increaseBiasIntensity.action: Consider progressing to upper end of bias ranges (coach approval)
increaseBiasIntensity.caution: Only in adult elite athletes, never Youth 17

athleteProfile.assessment: Force deficit - high RSI but low absolute force and strength

scenario1_adultForceDeficit.rationale: Squat <1.5x BW, RSI >2.0 indicates velocity-dominant profile needing force development

week1_sample.Monday_strength: Band3 Squat 4x5, Band3 RDL 3x6, Band2 Bench 3x8

prescriptionExample.gate7_result: ✓ PASS GREEN - 72% Band2-4 (target 70%), all safety gates passed

athleteProfile.assessment: Velocity deficit - high force but poor RSI and slow takeoff

scenario2_adultVelocityDeficit.rationale: Squat >2.0x BW, RSI <1.5 indicates force-dominant profile needing velocity/RFD work

week1_sample.Monday_elastic: E2-E3 Depth Jumps 3x4, Hurdle Hops 4x6, Bounds 3x8
week1_sample.Thursday_elastic: E2 Box Jumps 4x8, Pogo Hops 3x12, Med Ball Throws 3x8

prescriptionExample.gate7_result: ✓ PASS GREEN - 85% elastic work E1-E4 (target 70%+), Tier 3 = 22% (under 50% cap)

athleteProfile.assessment: Moderate force deficit, approved for conditional bias

scenario3_youth17_conditional.rationale: Youth 17 advanced, post-PHV, documented deficit. Approved with reduced bias intensity.

week1_sample.Monday_strength: Band2 Squat 4x6, Band2 RDL 3x8, Band1 Bench 3x10
week1_sample.Thursday_strength: Band3 Deadlift 4x5 (upper limit for Youth 17), Band2 Press 3x8

prescriptionExample.gate7_result: ✓ PASS GREEN - 60% Band2-3 (target 60% for Youth 17), Band4 = 0 (forbidden)
prescriptionExample.note: Modified FORCE_BIASED - more conservative than adult version

scenario4_youth15_enforceBalanced.rationale: Youth 16 and under must use BALANCED for general athletic development

week1_sample.Monday: Band1 Goblet Squat 3x10, Band1 Push-ups 3x12, E1 Jump Rope 3x30s
week1_sample.Wednesday: Band1 RDL 3x10, Band0 Core Work, E1-E2 Box Jumps 3x5
week1_sample.Friday: Band2 Squat 3x8 (upper end for Youth), E2 Bounds 3x6, Sprint 200m

prescriptionExample.gate7_result: ✓ PASS GREEN - BALANCED enforced, 50/50 distribution across spectrum
